DataElement.preferredName: Transrectal Ultrasound Prostate Assessment Volume Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value for three-dimensional volume of the prostate gland (male reproductive organ) determined by a diagnostic imaging technique where sound waves create a video image of the gland.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to examination of the prostate gland (male reproductive organ) using a diagnostic imaging technique where sound waves create a video image of the gland by echoes produced from a rectal probe.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the prostate gland. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter the prostate. Prostate tumors sometimes create echoes that are different from normal prostate tissue. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the prostate.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.

Property.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a value representing the calculated three-dimensional size or capacity of an organ in the human body as determined by surgical or pathological measure or by a diagnostic imaging procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
